title: 105_hr120
content:
The Act titled "Bankruptcy Law Technical Corrections Act of 1997" makes amendments to definitions in the United States Code related to bankruptcy. It includes adjustments to dollar amounts. SEC. 3. ADJUSTMENT OF DOLLAR AMOUNTS. Amendments made to Section 104 of title 11, United States Code, by inserting ``522(f)(3),'' after ``522(d),'' each place it appears. SEC. 4. EXTENSION OF TIME. Amendments to Section 108(c)(2) of title 11, United States Code, by striking ``922'' and all that follows through ``or'', and inserting ``922, 1201, or''. SEC. 5. PENALTY FOR PERSONS WHO NEGLIGENTLY OR FRAUDULENTLY PREPARE BANKRUPTCY PETITIONS. Amendments to Section 110(j)(3) of title 11, United States Code, by striking ``attorney's'' and inserting ``attorneys' ''. SEC. 6. ELIGIBILITY TO SERVE AS TRUSTEE. Amendments to paragraphs (1) and (2) of section 321(a) of title 11, United States Code, by striking ``7, 12,'' and inserting ``12''. SEC. 7. EMPLOYMENT OF PROFESSIONAL PERSONS. SEC. 7. EMPLOYMENT OF PROFESSIONAL PERSONS. Amendments to Section 327 of title 11, United States Code, regarding the authority of the Trustee and limitations on compensation of professional persons. SEC. 6. LIMITATION ON COMPENSATION OF PROFESSIONAL PERSONS. Amends Section 328(a) of title 11, United States Code, to include compensation "on a fixed or percentage fee basis."

SEC. 7. COMPENSATION TO OFFICERS. Amends Section 330(a) of title 11, United States Code, regarding compensation to officers and the debtor's attorney.

SEC. 8. SPECIAL TAX PROVISIONS. Amends Section 346(g)(1)(C) of title 11, United States Code, by striking certain language.

SEC. 9. EFFECT OF CONVERSION. Amends Section 348(f)(2) of title 11, United States Code, regarding the effect of conversion on property of the estate.

SEC. 10. AUTOMATIC STAY. SEC. 10. AUTOMATIC STAY. Section 362 of title 11, United States Code, is amended to include security interests created by transfers under section 547(c)(3) and changes "individual" to "entity." Section 365 of title 11, United States Code is amended to include provisions regarding the satisfaction of penalty rates in contracts, default provisions for nonmonetary obligations, and the removal of certain paragraphs in subsections (c) and (d), as well as a modification in subsection (f)(1). SEC. 12. AMENDMENT TO TABLE OF SECTIONS.

Amends the item relating to section 556 to include a contractual right to liquidate commodities or forward contracts.

SEC. 13. ALLOWANCE OF ADMINISTRATIVE EXPENSES.

Amends section 503(b)(4) of title 11, United States Code, to include subparagraphs (A), (B), (C), (D), or (E) before paragraph (3).

SEC. 14. PRIORITIES.

Amends section 507(a) of title 11, United States Code, to adjust punctuation in paragraph (3)(B) and add "unsecured" after "allowed" in paragraph (7).

SEC. 15. EXEMPTIONS. SEC. 15. EXEMPTIONS.

Amends Section 522 of title 11, United States Code to clarify liabilities designated as support and adjust references in subsection (g)(2). SEC. 16. Exceptions to discharge in bankruptcy are amended to include additional provisions related to debts owed to a spouse, former spouse, or child of the debtor, and specific conditions for debts on a prisoner by a Federal court. Subsection (e) is also updated for grammatical accuracy. SEC. 17. Amendment to Section 524(a)(3) of title 11, United States Code regarding discharge effects. SEC. 18. Amendment to Section 525(c) of title 11, United States Code for protection against discriminatory treatment. SEC. 19. Amendment to Section 541(b)(4)(B)(ii) of title 11, United States Code on property of the estate. SEC. 20. Amendment to Section 546 of title 11, United States Code on limitations of avoiding powers. SEC. 21. Liability of transferee of avoided transfer. SEC. 21. Liability of transferee of avoided transfer. Amends Section 550(c) of title 11, United States Code to clarify the liability of transferees for avoided transfers. Also includes a conforming amendment to Section 547(b) of title 11. Section 726(b) of title 11, United States Code is amended by removing "1009." Section 901(a) is amended by adding "1123(d)," after "1123(b)," and Section 1104(b) is amended regarding the appointment of an elected trustee. SEC. 26-31 amend various sections of title 11, United States Code, including changes to railroad line abandonment, plan contents, payments, and discharge procedures. SEC. 31 amends section 1328(a) of title 11, US Code regarding discharge of debts in bankruptcy cases. SEC. 32 modifies section 1334(d) of title 28, US Code related to bankruptcy cases and proceedings. SEC. 33 revises the Bankruptcy Review Commission section. SEC. 34 addresses knowing disregard of bankruptcy law or rule. SEC. 34 amends section 156(a) of title 18, US Code regarding knowing disregard of bankruptcy law or rule. SEC. 35 specifies the effective date and application of the amendments made by this Act.
